intro: Phaeocephalum miliaceum, commonly known as the millet-headed phaeocephalum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has a woody stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
